links.*: Letter to George and Moira Sayer (7 August 1952)
The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
[[File:J.R.R. Tolkien - The Laughing Philosopher.jpg|thumb|[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in 1952]]
==January==
* '''[[20 January|20]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] starts supervising [[Brian Miller]]'s work on the [[Middle English]] ''Dame Sirith''.
==February==
* '''[[7 February|7]]''' - The [[Inklings]] have dinner at [[C.S. Lewis]]' house, in the company of Dr. Firor of John Hopkins University. The evening was described by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] as ''"like a glimpse of old times: quiet and rational (since [[Hugo Dyson|Hugo]] was not asked)."'' 
* '''[[10 February|10]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 132]].
* '''[[11 February|11]]''' - Actor [[Paul Norell]] is born.
* '''[[19 February|19]]''' - Actor [[Geoff Morrell]] is born.

==March==
* '''[[23 March|23]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 132a]].
==April==
* '''[[30 April|30]]''' - Brazilian translator [[Ronald Kyrmse]] is born.
==May==
* '''[[27 April|27]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] acts as host to the [[Oxford Dante Society]].
==June==
* '''?''' - [[Rayner Unwin]] writes a letter to Tolkien, enquiring about ''[[Errantry]]'' and the publication efforts of his works.
* '''[[22 June|22]]''' - After being turned down by [[HarperCollins|Collins]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] [[letter 133|writes]] to [[Rayner Unwin]], saying he would prefer to have just the ''Lord of the Rings'' published than nothing at all.
==July==
* '''[[1 July|1]]''' - [[Rayner Unwin]] replies to Tolkien, expressing his interest in reading the finished ''Lord of the Rings'' and discussing the publishing of the ''[[Silmarillion]]'' later,<ref>{{HM|L}}, p. 163-4</ref> ending their earlier dispute.
* '''[[1 July|1]]''' - Musician [[David Arkenstone]] is born.
* '''?''' - Actor [[Brian George]] is born.
==August==
* '''[[7 August|7]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to George and Moira Sayer (7 August 1952)|a letter to George and Moira Sayer]].
* '''[[10 August|10]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Moira Sayer (10 August 1952)|a letter to Moira Sayer]].
*'''[[11 August|11]]–[[18 August|18]]''' - Tolkien visits [[Cambridge]] to view the ''Ancrene Wisse'' manuscript.
* '''[[29 August|29]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 134]].
* '''[[30 August|30]]''' - Translator [[Helmut W. Pesch]] is born.
* '''Late''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] visits [[George Sayer]]. Sayer makes [[1952 tape recording|an audio recording]] of Tolkien singing and reading excerpts from his works (e.g., [[Namárië]]).

==October==
* '''[[17 October|17]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is appointed supervisor of [[T.P. Dunning]]'s thesis.
* '''[[21 October|21]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 134a]].
* '''[[24 October|24]]''' - Tolkien writes [[letter 135]].
==November==
* '''[[12 November|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 135a]].
* '''[[13 November|13]]''' - [[C. S. Lewis]] writes a letter to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].
==December==
* '''[[28 December|28]]''' - Game developer [[Wendell Lariston Hill, Jr.]] is born
==?==
* '''?''' (Fall) - Retreating to [[Michael Tolkien]]'s home at Woodcote, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] rereads, revises and corrects ''The Lord of the Rings''.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. xxxi</ref> 
* '''?''' - Artist [[Stephen Raw]], who would be commissioned to redraw [[:Category:Images by Stephen Raw|the maps]] for the revised [[1994]] edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', is born.
* '''?''' - [[Ballantine Books]] is founded.
{{references}}
